alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing an alpha amino acid which bears an acyl group at its terminal nitrogen atom.
alternative_parents.name: N-acyl-alpha amino acids

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing hippuric acid, which consists of a of a benzoyl group linked to the N-terminal of a glycine.
alternative_parents.name: Hippuric acids

alternative_parents.description: Polycyclic aromatic compounds containing a pteridine moiety, which consists of a pyrimidine fused to a pyrazine ring to form  pyrimido(4,5-b)pyrazine.
alternative_parents.name: Pteridines and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a benzamide moiety with an amine group attached to the benzene ring.
alternative_parents.name: Aminobenzamides

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an aminobenzene moiety.
alternative_parents.name: Aniline and substituted anilines

alternative_parents.description: Aliphatic aromatic amines in which the amino group is linked to two aliphatic chains and one aromatic group.
alternative_parents.name: Dialkylarylamines

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an acyl moiety of benzoic acid with the formula (C6H5CO-).
alternative_parents.name: Benzoyl derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an amino group attached to a pyrimidine ring. Pyrimidine is a 6-membered ring consisting of four carbon atoms and two nitrogen centers at the 1- and 3- ring positions.
alternative_parents.name: Aminopyrimidines and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Alkylamines in which the alkyl group is substituted at one carbon atom by an aromatic hydrocarbyl group.
alternative_parents.name: Aralkylamines

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a pyrazine ring, which is a six-member aromatic heterocycle, that consists of two nitrogen atoms (at positions 1 and 4) and four carbon atoms.
alternative_parents.name: Pyrazines

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing exactly two carboxylic acid groups.
alternative_parents.name: Dicarboxylic acids and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing an aromatic ring where a carbon atom is linked to an hetero atom.
alternative_parents.name: Heteroaromatic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a secondary carboxylic acid amide functional group, with the general structure RC(=O)N(R')H (R,R'=alkyl, aryl).
alternative_parents.name: Secondary carboxylic acid amides

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds that contain at least one carboxyl group and one amino group.
alternative_parents.name: Amino acids

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a carboxylic acid group with the formula -C(=O)OH.
alternative_parents.name: Carboxylic acids

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an heterocycle with at least one nitrogen atom and one carbon atom linked to each other.
alternative_parents.name: Azacyclic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Amines having the nitrogen atom linked to exactly one hydrocarbyl group.
alternative_parents.name: Primary amines

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a bond between carbon a pnictogen atom. Pnictogens are p-block element atoms that are in the group 15 of the periodic table.
alternative_parents.name: Organopnictogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a carbonyl group, with the general structure RC(=O)R', where R=organyl, R'=H, N, O, organyl group or halide group.
alternative_parents.name: Carbonyl compounds

class.description: Compounds containing a carboxylic acid group with the formula -C(=O)OH or a derivative thereof.
class.name: Carboxylic acids and derivatives

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as glutamic acid and derivatives. These are compounds containing glutamic acid or a derivative thereof resulting from reaction of glutamic acid at the amino group or the carboxy group, or from the replacement of any hydrogen of glycine by a heteroatom.

direct_parent.description: Compounds containing glutamic acid or a derivative thereof resulting from reaction of glutamic acid at the amino group or the carboxy group, or from the replacement of any hydrogen of glycine by a heteroatom.
direct_parent.name: Glutamic acid and derivatives

intermediate_nodes.description: Organic compounds containing an amine group, a carboxylic acid group (or a derivative thereof), and a side-chain that is specific to each amino acid.
intermediate_nodes.name: Amino acids and derivatives

intermediate_nodes.description: Amino acids in which the amino group is attached to the carbon atom immediately adjacent to the carboxylate group (alpha carbon), or a derivative thereof.
intermediate_nodes.name: Alpha amino acids and derivatives

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Organic compounds containing an amino acid or a peptide backbone, or derivatives thereof.
subclass.name: Amino acids, peptides, and analogues

superclass.description: Compounds an organic acid or a derivative thereof.
superclass.name: Organic acids and derivatives
